byline.contributor: Matt A.V. Chaban reported from Hoboken, and Emma G. Fitzsimmons from New York. Eli Rosenberg contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By MATT A.V. CHABAN and EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS

abstract: Spokesman for National Transportation Safety Board says federal inspection of train involved in crash at New Jersey Transit's Hoboken Terminal has not begun due to concerns about structural integrity of building and possible release of asbestos in area around damage.
lead_paragraph: Safety concerns at the site have posed a challenge to investigators, allowing few answers to emerge about why the train careened into a wall at Hoboken Terminal.
snippet: Safety concerns at the site have posed a challenge to investigators, allowing few answers to emerge about why the train careened into a wall at Hoboken Terminal....

headline.main: Federal Investigators Search for Cause of Deadly Hoboken Train Crash
headline.print_headline: Wreckage in New Jersey Is Slow to Offer Answers
